description.narrative:
DEVELOPMENT IMPACT - PROJECT OUTCOMES:
Stakeholders: The project will create better access to finance for around 20,000 women MSME customers at an affordable rate. This Project is expected to directly fund c. 2,500 WMSMEs. Over the next 5 years, SFCL is projected to provide in total 20,000 facilities to WOEs totaling c. USD 160 million (LKR 25 billion). The project will also support SFCL to increase its branch network over the next 5 years. The new branches will be established mainly in rural regions, where access to finance for MSME's are a challenge. Economy-wide effects: The combined economic activity would result in an increase in tax revenue to the state at a time where the fiscal position is under stress due to high debt servicing cost. Further SenFin's branch expansion would create around 250 new financial sector jobs in rural regions. In addition, based on IFC Jobs Study, Sri Lanka (2012), an est.1,500-4,650 new direct jobs will be created by this project at the WMSME level. In addition, there will be indirect job creation, which cannot be quantified.
DEVELOPMENT IMPACT - CONTRIBUTION TO MARKET CREATION:
Competitiveness: The credit gap for women entrepreneurs in Sri Lanka is estimated at USD 350 million. This project is likely to incentivise Banks and other NBFI's to launch funding programs targeted at women. The availability of credit, would enable WMSME's to compete and be a part of local/global value chains and grow their businesses by accessing domestic and foreign markets, which are not currently accessible.

mailing-address.narrative: Senkadagala Finance PLC Mr. Shanker Supramaniam Chief Manager Treasury +94112301301 shanker@senfin.com 2nd Floor, 267, Galle Road, Colombo 3, Sri Lanka www.senfin.com
